name: Update User List with Active Users
title: Update User List with Active Users
body:
If you are not using user provisioning to maintain your console's user list, you can use a combination of the Archive Users option and the CSV Import tool to update your active users. When users are archived, they are no longer considered Active Users, but their data is still available in the console.

Important: Do not use this method if you have a training campaign that allows users to take courses multiple times. Archiving and reimporting users will re-enroll them in these training campaigns. The user's original enrollment and completion data will still be available, but they will show as enrolled in the same training again. If this issue occurs, we suggest checking out this article for directions on removing the re-enrolled users.  

To update your active users, follow the steps below:

  1. Prepare a CSV file that contains the current employees who you would like to keep as Active in the console. See our How Do I Import Users with a CSV File? article for more information.
  2. In your KnowBe4 console, navigate to the Users tab. 
  3. From the header of the Users List, click on Download CSV.
  4. Open the downloaded CSV file and delete all columns, except for column A. Keep only the Email column with your users' email addresses. Be sure to also remove the headers of all the deleted columns, not just the data within them.
  5. Save the edited CSV file. 
  6. In your KnowBe4 console, from the header of the Users List, click on Bulk Archive.
  7. From the window that appears, click Browse and upload the edited CSV file.
  8. Choose your notification settings, then click Archive. 
  9. Once all of your users are archived, go to Users > Import Users and click on CSV Import.
  10. Click Browse and upload the CSV file from Step 1—it should contain the current employees who you would like to include as Active users.
  11. Choose your notification settings, then click Import Users.
  12. All of the users in the imported CSV will be restored, along with their past data. Any user not included in the imported CSV file will remain archived.

images.alt:
This image displays the **Users** management interface of a software platform, focused on user administration and data export.

**1. Primary Navigation and Context:**
The interface is structured with a tabbed navigation bar. The active tab is **Users**. Other available sections include: **Groups**, **Import Users**, **Provisioning**, **Merge Users**, and **Security Roles**.

**2. Controls and Actions (Filtering and Export):**
Located above the user list are filters and bulk actions:
*   **Filters:** **Status: Active**, **Type: All**, and **Groups: All** (all indicated as dropdown selectors).
*   **Bulk Actions:** **Bulk Archive** (with an archive icon).
*   **Data Export:** A prominent, highlighted button labeled **Download CSV** (featuring a green download icon).
*   **Search:** A search box allowing input for "Search by email or name...," accompanied by a search icon and a settings gear dropdown.

**3. User Data Table Structure:**
The table header lists eight columns, with most columns allowing sorting (indicated by dual arrow icons):
*   Checkbox (for row selection)
*   **User** (Email and full name displayed on two lines)
*   **PPP** (Phish Prone Percentage)
*   **Risk**
*   **Groups**
*   **Joined on** (Date)
*   **Last Sign-In** (Date)
*   **Actions** (A dropdown menu for individual user actions)

**4. Example Data Content:**
The first three rows display user details. The "User" column displays a cloud/download icon next to the email, suggesting a synchronized or provisioned status.
*   **User 1:** Adrian.Lueilwitz@professorphisher.com, PPP: 0%, Risk: 0, Groups: professorphisher.com, Joined: 10/12/2020, Last Sign-In: 11/12/2020.
*   **User 2:** Alpha.DuBuque@knowbe4.com, PPP: 0%, Risk: 0, Groups: knowbe4.com, Joined: 10/12/2020, Last Sign-In: 11/05/2020.

> tab. 
From the header of the Users List, click on Download CSV.

images.alt:
This image displays a data grid, characteristic of a spreadsheet application interface, showing extracted data in four visible columns labeled A, B, C, and D.

**UI Elements and Structure:**
*   The interface utilizes standard grid lines for cell delineation.
*   The column header row (Row 1) is highlighted with a light blue background, visually separating it from the data entries below.
*   Column A is populated; Columns B, C, and D are empty.

**Text and Context:**
*   **Header:** Cell A1 contains the header text: "Email".
*   **Data (Column A):** Cells A2 through approximately A16 contain a sequential list of email addresses, likely intended as demonstration data.
*   **Data Content Examples:** The entries consist of user identifiers (names or system roles) followed by standardized demo domains, such as:
    *   `Abbey.O'Keefe@kb4-demo.com`
    *   `Abby.Zboncak@kb4salesdemo.net`
    *   `admin@kb4-demo.com`
    *   `Alaina.Schneider@kb4salesdemo.co.uk`
*   The data is organized in a single, alphabetized list within Column A.
images.context: Be sure to also remove the headers of all the deleted columns, not just the data within them.

images.alt:
This screenshot displays the **"Manage Users"** administrative interface.

**Top Navigation and Actions:**
The primary title is **"Manage Users."** A primary action button, **"Add Users"** (with a dropdown), is located in the top-right corner.

**Sub-Navigation:**
A row of sub-navigation tabs is present. The **"Users"** tab is active (selected). Other available tabs include: "Groups," "Import Users," "Provisioning," "Merge Users," "Messages," and "Security Roles."

**Filtering and Utility Bar:**
Filters above the data table include dropdown selectors for: **"Status: Active," "Type: All,"** and **"Groups: All."** Bulk actions are available via hyperlinks: **"Bulk Archive"** and **"Generate CSV."** A search component allows input via **"Search by email or name..."** and includes Search and Settings (gear) icons.

**Data Table Structure:**
The interface presents user data in a sortable table. Column headers (all sortable via up/down arrows unless noted) are:
*   User (Includes a selection checkbox, email, and full name)
*   PPP
*   Risk
*   Location
*   Groups
*   Joined on
*   Last Login
*   Actions (Dropdown menu)

**Data Content Example:**
The third row is highlighted (in light blue) and selected via a checkbox. This entry corresponds to **"admin@kb4-demo.com / Aaron Anderson"** and displays values: PPP **100%**, Risk **10.3**, and an extensive list of Groups (including IT, Accounting, and Justice League). The Joined on and Last Login dates are **06/21/2022** and **12/21/2022**, respectively.
images.context:
upload the edited CSV file.
Choose your notification settings, then click Archive.

images.alt:
The image displays a user interface screen focused on user import functionality.

**Context and Navigation:**
The current view is defined by the active top navigation tab, **"Import Users."** Other visible tabs include "Users," "Groups," "Provisioning," and "Merge Users."

**Import Method Selection:**
A segmented control below the main navigation shows two options: "Quick Import" and **"CSV Import."** The "CSV Import" button is selected (dark gray background).

**User Interface Elements:**
1.  **File Upload:** A required section titled **"Upload a CSV file"** contains a file input field with the placeholder text "Please select a file..." and an accompanying button labeled **"Browse..."**
2.  **Notification Configuration:** A section titled **"Notify Upon Import Completion (Optional)"** includes a dropdown menu labeled "Select one or more administrators..."
3.  **Default Notification:** A checkbox is present and checked, labeled **"Send import notifications to ols@knowbe4.com."**
images.context: trong>Step 1—it should contain the current employees who you would like to include as Active users.
